description: One-minute skill: Passkeys: The End of Passwords?.

hook.text: Apple, Google, and Microsoft are replacing passwords with passkeys. No more typing, no more forgetting, no.

buildup.text: Passkeys use public-key cryptography. Your device holds a private key; the website holds the public key. No.

discovery.text: Authentication happens through biometrics on your device. The private key never leaves your phone or computer.

twist.text: Passkeys are domain-bound â€” they only work on the real website. A phishing page can't trigger your passkey for the real site.

climax.text: Passkeys eliminate the three biggest password problems: reuse, phishing, and breach-exposed credentials. The future is keyless.

punchline.text: No password to steal. No password to forget. No password to phish.

quiz.question: Why are passkeys resistant to phishing?
options: They're cryptographically bound to the real website's domain, ignoring fake sites
